page.title: 15SIDDINGTON SHEPHERD
page.content: I'm a shepherd.We have 600 ewes.They are housed and shorn in January and stay inside till lambing.This begins in mid-March and lasts a month.At lambing time I start work at 4am.As each ewe lambs she and her lamb are taken to smaller pens. Each lamb receives a dose of anti-biotics and has iodine sprayed on its navel.The ewe has hay and water.Some ewes need help lambing.These I attend to.Lamb stealing by other ewes is a problem too.At 7.30 my assistants arrive.Their jobs are:feeding silage and hay,pen cleaning,footrotting ewes and taking ewes and lambs to pasture.Cold,wet weather is a killer for young lambs.I treat hypothermic ones by injecting glucose into their stomachs and warming them. Another job, adopting triplets or orphan lambs to ewes with single or dead lambs.Work ends at 6.30
